alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 8:19PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Brown, Kewaunee, southern Door, Calumet, east central Winnebago and Manitowoc Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 818 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Oconto to Bay Shore Park to near Denmark to 8 miles north of Brillion to near Oshkosh. Movement was east at 30 mph.HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bay Shore Park and Denmark around 825 PM CDT. Luxemburg around 830 PM CDT. Northern Lake Winnebago around 840 PM CDT. High Cliff State Park and Central Lake Winnebago around 845 PM CDT. Kewaunee, Algoma and Two Creeks around 850 PM CDT. Chilton around 855 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Curran, Wayside, Gregorville, Rankin, Newtonberg, St John, Shirley, Potter, Lincoln and Cooperstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Winnebago
